faq.description: Everything you need to know about creating a tribute.

q1.q: How long will the memorial page last?
q1.a: Your memorial page is preserved indefinitely. We are committed to keeping your memories safe for generations to come.

q2.q: Can I control who sees the memorial page?
q2.a: Yes, you have complete control. You can make the page public, private (password protected), or visible only to invited guests.

q3.q: How do I invite family and friends to contribute?
q3.a: You can share a simple link via email, text, or social media. Guests can contribute photos and stories without needing to create an account.

q4.q: Is there a limit to photos and videos I can upload?
q4.a: No, we offer unlimited storage for photos, videos, and stories. You can preserve as many memories as you wish.

q5.q: Can I edit the memorial page after creating it?
q5.a: Absolutely. You can edit text, add or remove photos, and change settings at any time as the page administrator.

q6.q: What happens if I need help or support?
q6.a: Our support team is available 24/7. You can reach out to us anytime, and we will help you with any questions or technical issues.

q7.a: We offer a free plan to get started. Our premium features, including unlimited storage and advanced privacy, are available for a one-time payment.

q8.q: Can I download or export my memorial page?
q8.a: Yes, you can download a complete archive of all photos, videos, and messages shared on your memorial page at any time.

memorial_page.bio_fallback: Eleanor Rose Mitchell was a shining example of warmth, wisdom, and unwavering love. Born in a small coastal town in Maine, she grew up surrounded by the rhythm of the sea and the comfort of her family.
memorial_page.demo_comment_0_text: Mom, you were my guiding star, my safe haven, and my greatest teacher. Your love made me who I am today. I miss you every single day.
memorial_page.demo_comment_1_text: Mrs. Mitchell was the teacher who changed my life. She believed in me when I didn't believe in myself.
memorial_page.demo_comment_2_text: Eleanor, my dear friend for 40 years. We laughed so much, cried so much.
memorial_page.demo_comment_3_text: Grandma, every visit with you was an unforgettable experience.
memorial_page.bio_p1: From an early age, {{firstName}} showed a natural talent for bringing people together, whether through her infectious laughter or her extraordinary baking skills that made every gathering a feast.
memorial_page.bio_p2: After graduating with honors in English studies, she dedicated her life to teaching. She was convinced that every child has a story to tell and committed herself fully to that belief.
memorial_page.bio_p3: {{firstName}}'s greatest joy was her family. For 52 wonderful years, she was a devoted wife, a caring mother, and a loving grandmother. Her home was always open.
memorial_page.bio_quote: Such a gentle soul, such a pure heart
memorial_page.closing_quote: Those we love don't go away, they walk beside us every day.
memorial_page.closing_tribute: {{firstName}}'s light will shine on through the love she gave, the wisdom she shared, and the countless lives she touched. May her memory be a blessing to all who knew her.
